meanings.definition: To arrange in a neat and orderly manner.
meanings.sent1: She comby her toys on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Please comby your clothes before putting them away.
meanings.sent3: He comby the books on the desk like a pro.
meanings.sent4: The gardener comby the flowers in the garden with care.
meanings.sent5: The teacher comby the students in a straight line for the field trip.

meanings.sent1: The red comby parked in front of the house.
meanings.sent2: My dad drives a blue comby to work every day.
meanings.sent3: The comby zipped through the city streets with ease.
meanings.sent4: The comby hummed along the highway like a little beetle.
meanings.sent5: I dream of owning a comby one day for my daily commute.

meanings.definition: A hairstyle in which the hair is neatly arranged.
meanings.sent1: Her comby was adorned with a pretty ribbon.
meanings.sent2: The actress sported a classic comby at the award show.
meanings.sent3: He tried to recreate the comby from the fashion magazine.
meanings.sent4: The comby framed her face elegantly for the party.
meanings.sent5: The comby stayed intact even after a windy day at the beach.
